Description: Rim sherd of South Ionian pottery chalice-cup; interior: reserved band at top of rim, glazed black below; exterior: two black bands around edge of rim, reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Such sherds have been identified as kantharoi by some scholars and as chalice cups by others. The horizontal handle usually found suggests that these are chalice cups. According to Schlotzhauer, while chalices are now known from excavations at Miletus, this type is not represented. For parallels, see British Museum 1886,0401.360, which may be from the same cup.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.732) (phase)
